intro: Pedicularis nobilis, commonly known as the noble lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Pedicularis nobilis is often found in rocky or open habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
